thread.title: H.S. football: Brendan Coffey leads Cresskill over Park Ridge - Football
thread.title_full: H.S. football: Brendan Coffey leads Cresskill over Park Ridge - Football - NorthJersey.com

author: GREG MATTURA
title: H.S. football: Brendan Coffey leads Cresskill over Park Ridge - Football
text:
PARK RIDGE — Brendan Coffey capped one of the longest touchdown drives you’ll ever see in North Jersey football with one of the shortest scoring runs.
Coffey scored on a run from inside the 1-yard-line with three seconds left to lift Cresskill to an 18-15 victory over previously unbeaten Park Ridge in the NJIC Meadowlands Division.
Coffey’s TD capped a 20-play drive that began on the Cresskill 38-yard line, ate up 9 minutes, 26 seconds on the clock, and came one play after he was stopped cold for no gain on first down.
"This was the play of our season," said Coffey, who ran behind the left side of his line after being stopped a play earlier running right, "because we’re out of the playoffs if we lose this game."
"We knew we had two plays to get it in," Cresskill coach Kevin Quinn said. "[Park Ridge] put up a heck of a fight, [on first down] so we said ‘let’s go the other way’ and our guys came through."
Cresskill (4-2) joins Park Ridge (5-1) in the chase for a North 1, Group 1 bid thanks to an epic TD drive in which Coffey did most of the work. 
The senior running back carried 15 times for a hard-earned 45 yards, and the Cougars did not earn more than nine yards on any play during the drive.
"They took us out of a lot by really pounding the ball and controlling the time on the clock," said Park Ridge coach Tom Curry Jr. "With our big strike capability, they were able to keep [senior quarterback Evan] Matthews on the sideline."
Coffey had given Cresskill a 12-7 lead in the third when he scored on a 76-yard run. That was the Cougars’ only play of more than 15 yards.
Park Ridge had taken a 15-12 lead with 9:43 left in the game on a 2-yard keeper by Matthews. His TD capped a 17-play drive that began on the Owls’ 33-yard line.
Park Ridge took a 7-6 lead at 2:09 of the second quarter when Matthews threw a 16-yard touchdown pass to junior receiver Joshua Lewis. Senior Kurt Nixdorf added the extra point.
Cresskill grabbed a 6-0 lead at 5:01 of the second quarter when Coffey scored on a 3-yard run to cap a 10-play drive that began on the Cougars 20 yard line. The 2-point conversion run was stopped short.
